go_data.justification: Fas(CD95) initiates different signal transduction pathways by recruiting different types of intracellular signal transducers to the receptor complex.
FADD, a novel death domain-containing protein, interacts with the death domain of Fas and initiates apoptosis.
Fas(CD95) is a receptor that recruits signal transducers to the receptor complex, implying its location in the plasma membrane.
Fas(CD95) initiates different signal transduction pathways by recruiting different types of intracellular signal transducers to the receptor complex.
Fas(CD95) interacts with the death domain of FADD/MORT1, RIP, or TRADD through the interactions of their respective death domains.
